Rearming is a crucial step. You need to plan everything in advance! Consider not only how much your soldiers' stats will increase but also the price of ammunition. It's also worth considering which merchants you'll need to purchase it from (your merchant's inventory won't change!!!). The recruitment price for a soldier will also change after rearming, depending on the base price of ammunition. The cost of rearming depends on how many soldiers will be rearmed. If there aren't enough soldiers, rearming is free. Any previously used ammunition the soldiers had before rearming will be stored in the warehouse. The ammunition you specify will be taken from the warehouse. If the required ammunition is in short supply, the soldier type will not be rearmed!

Preparing for recruitment
You need to prepare additional spots for your future soldiers in advance. Grants +1 to the limit of each recruit type (Stacks with other similar improvements).
Purchase Svarog detectors
This is the highest among detectors. Even a Garbage novice can find an artifact using it. Increases artifact search success by 5% (stacks with other similar upgrades).
Hunter's courses
Mutants. You need to know not only how to fight them, but also how to profit from them. Increases the number of parts obtained by +1 per monster.
Standardization of clearing tactics

Experience of clearing the area shows that mutants have specific behavior patterns. We need to adapt tactics to their behavior so that commanders won't need to constantly monitor the situation. The cost of clearing is reduced by 2 CR.
Establishment of headquarters
All leaders need to have clear communication with each other! Grants +4 to CR every turn (Stacks with other similar improvements)
Establishment of a command
Personnel, as they say, decide everything. The most experienced, the most capable. Grants +15 to the CR limit (Stacks with other similar improvements)
Structural chain of command
A Marshal never gives orders directly to a private. There must be a chain of command to manage large numbers of soldiers. Grants +3 to CR each turn (Stacks with other similar improvements).
Command chain optimization
Opportunists and other lazy people are out. Only useful and essential people. Strict, precise, and specific. No frills. Grants +4 to CR every turn (Stacks with other similar improvements).
Rapid Response Team
Duty schedule for command staff. Staff must be on call 24/7 and know what to do! Grants +6 to CR every turn (Stacks with other similar improvements)
Careful collection of loot
Searching, hacking PDAs, finding loot in caches using tags, and so on... Doubles the amount of loot obtained from each stalker.
Briefing on recruiting soldiers

Briefing soldiers upon recruitment can reduce commander intervention in operations such as "Redeployment," "Reconnaissance in Force," "Capture," and "Abandon." Soldiers will already know the ropes upon recruitment. This will reduce the cost of each operation by 1 CR.
Recruitment

You need to reward soldiers for inviting their friends and acquaintances to join the group. This way, you motivate them to do this more often! Grants +1 to each recruit type in each territory where these recruits spawn each turn (Stacks with other similar improvements)
Night vision devices for reconnaissance

Having eyes on the enemy base is good, but those eyes also need to be able to see at night, as the enemy can conceal their movements in the Zone's darkness. Increases the chance of mission success by 10%.
Formation of a reconnaissance detachment

If a faction uses reconnaissance personnel frequently, it would be effective to create a detachment that would prepare for operations in advance. This would halve the cost of deploying a soldier to a combat mission.
